page.title: 09INDUSTRIAL SURVIVAL
page.content: our area at Maddocks Quarry, where sandstone is quaried. What then remains of an industrial tradition ? And what efforts are being made to salvage something for the future ? At Doseley, Johnston Pipes Limited, founded in the area in 1904, continue an important local industrial tradition. They employ 73 staff and 80 weekly paid employees. All of the employees live in the locsl area. The average age of the workforce is 27 and most workers earn over Â£100 per week. Concrete pipes were first made at the factory in 1931. In the past decade the company has become noted for its manufacture of glass reinforced plastic pipes. These are used in sewage and water carrying systems. Their export potential, paricularly to the Middle East, has earned the factory a Queen's Award for Industry.
